dct_description_sm: Based on Arnold Colomâ€™s world map from approximately 1655. California depicted with one shallow northern bay to the right of C. Mendocino. To the northwest of the island is a landmass called Nova Albion with many place names including C. Banco, Serra Nevada and again, C. Mendocino.
Eastern hemisphere cartouche repeats the title in Dutch: NIEWE WERELT CAART. Western hemisphere cartouche gives general information about the map in Latin.
Hemispheres surrounded by six figures representing, clockwise, fire, day, air, sea, night and earth.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
